summary: In this context, 1-methyl-4-propan-2-ylbenzene (also known as 4-isopropyltoluene) is mentioned alongside toluene as part of a list of volatile organic compounds (VOCs) found in soil samples. Both compounds are noted for their common use as solvents and fuel components. However, the context does not elaborate on any specific interactions or functional relationships between 1-methyl-4-propan-2-ylbenzene and toluene beyond their shared classification as VOCs.
